meanings.definition: To remove something written or drawn by rubbing or scraping it away.
meanings.sent1: She erases the mistake on her paper with an eraser.
meanings.sent2: He erases the whiteboard after each lesson.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student erases the answer key to play a prank.
meanings.sent4: Time erases the memories we wish to forget.
meanings.sent5: The wind erases footprints in the sand, leaving a clean slate.

meanings.definition: To remove all traces of something; to obliterate.
meanings.sent1: The detective erases all evidence of the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: The rain erases the chalk drawings on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The magician erases the image on the card, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: Forgiveness erases the bitterness in one's heart.
meanings.sent5: The artist erases the initial sketch to start anew with a fresh idea.
